title: Loops moving near current carrying wire

content.question: Two conducting wire loops move near a very long, straight conducting wire that carries a current I. When the loops are in the positions shown above, they are moving in the directions shown with the same constant speed v. Assume that the loops are far enough apart that they do not affect each other. Which of the following is true about the induced electric currents, if any,in the loops?

choices.label: Loop 1 Loop 2 No current No current
Loop 1 Loop 2 No current Counterclockwise direction
Loop 1 Loop 2 Clockwise direction No Current
Loop 1 Loop 2 Clockwise direction Clockwise direction
Loop 1 Loop 2 Counterclockwise direction Clockwise direction

content.answer: Loop 1 Loop 2 Clockwise direction No Current

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
